page.title: 18BURRINGTON SERVICES
page.content: ELECTRICITY. In 1937 there were only two houses in the village which had electricity. Hillcrest & Homelands were supplied by their own generator. Mr.Western put in an electric plant to supply all the village with electric light.In 1957, mains electricity made it possible to run electrically-powered machinery. MAINS WATER. Some houses are still supplied by their own wells, but mains water came to the village in 1955. The amount used is metered for large consumers. SEWAGE. The sewage plant was built on land below Town Bridge in 1974. BUS SERVICES. On Tuesdays & Fridays there is a bus,run by Wills' Coaches, to take shoppers to Barnstaple.It leaves The Square at 9.30a.m.& returns at 3p.m.
